posts.name: Amy's Ice Cream - South Congress Ave
posts.note: Local chain serving inventive ice creams, milkshakes, ices and frozen yogurts with clever fixings.

posts.name: Franklins BBQ
posts.note: Long lines form early for brisket, pulled pork and other smoked meats at this lunch-only spot.

posts.name: G'Raj Mahal Cafe and Lounge
posts.note: This brick-and-mortar outpost of a former food truck serves Indian fare and has a tented space outdoors.

posts.name: Gourdoughs Doughnuts
posts.note: Ironic names and unique toppings on fried-dough treats served until late-night from a vintage trailer.

posts.name: GÃ¼ero's Taco Bar
posts.note: A large menu, salsa bar & hand-shaken margaritas in a landmark building with a patio.

posts.name: Ironworks BBQ
posts.note: Barbecued meats, including signature beef ribs, and specialty sauces in a historic former iron shop.

posts.name: Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill
posts.note: Contemporary comfort food and cocktails in a historic home with a patio.

posts.name: Noble Pig
posts.note: A farm-to-table slant applies to big breakfast & lunch in casual, counter-service digs with a patio.

posts.name: Salt Lick BBQ
posts.note: It's BYOB at this venerable cash-only, BBQ spot with a rustic setting and live music outdoors.

posts.name: Smitty's Market
posts.note: Acclaimed BBQ spot offering meats fresh from the smoker in a no-frills space with communal tables.

posts.name: South Congress Cafe
posts.note: Known for its Bloody Mary, carrot-cake French toast & daily brunch & dinner in a retro-modern room.

posts.name: Stubbs BBQ
posts.note: Beer, brisket and music Downtown with a renowned Sunday gospel brunch.

posts.name: Torchy's Tacos
posts.note: Local chain serving Mexican-street-food-style tacos in inventive varieties, including for breakfast.
